alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 6:47AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Winter weather makes a return tonight through Wednesday... The warm and dry weather will end tonight and Monday as winter- like conditions return to northern and central Nevada. The snow showers will be around through mid-week. A band of valley rain and mountain snow showers will push into northern Elko and Humboldt counties this afternoon and evening, spreading south and east overnight into Monday morning. As the colder air filters in behind the cold front, valley rain should switch over to snow tonight into Monday. Snow showers will continue each afternoon with light amounts expected. For the entire period Monday through Wednesday, valley locations could see up to an inch to possibly three inches in localized areas, while the mountains are expected to see three to six inches through the entire mid-week period. Winds will also become breezy to windy from the west and southwest today with gusty northerly winds behind the cold front Monday across central Nevada. Some spots of blowing and drifting snow are possible, especially on higher passes and summits. Temperatures on Monday are expected to be 15 to 20 degrees colder than today, with highs only in the 30s to lower 40s. Colder temperatures are expected midweek with highs below freezing in many locations Wednesday and lows in some valleys Thursday morning well into the single digits. Motorists should remain alert to rapidly changing weather, and take necessary precautions if travel is necessary. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
